citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Salinicola: transfer of Halomonas salaria and Chromohalobacter salarius to the genus Salinicola as Salinicola salarius comb. nov. and Salinicola halophilus nom. nov., respectively
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Salinicola socius Anan'ina et al. 2008
Salinicola socius (so′ci.us, L. masc. adj. socius associated, referring to membership in a microbial association).
The characteristics of this species are as described by Anan'ina et al. (2007), with the addition of the following features.
Grows in the range 15 to 40 °C.
Exopolysaccharide is not produced.
Poly-β-hydroxyalkanoate is produced.
Respiration on fumarate, nitrate and nitrite is negative.
Tween 20 is hydrolysed.
Casein, DNA, tyrosine and aesculin are not hydrolysed.
Methyl red and phosphatase tests are positive.
Indole is not produced.
Voges–Proskauer test is negative.
Lysine- and ornithine-decarboxylase-negative.
Gluconate is not oxidized.
Selenite is not reduced.

The following compounds are used as sole carbon and energy sources: aesculin, d-arabinose, cellobiose, fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, sucrose, salicin, starch, d-xylose, butanol, dulcitol, ethanol, glycerol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, methanol, propanol, d-sorbitol, xylitol, acetate, benzoate, citrate, fumarate, hippurate and propionate.
The following compounds are not used as sole carbon and energy sources: d-fucose, lactose, ribose, trehalose, formate, malate, succinate, tartrate and valerate.
The following compounds are used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: l-alanine, glutamine, isoleucine, l-lysine, l-ornithine, l-serine, l-threonine and tryptophan.
The following compounds are not used as sole carbon, nitrogen and energy sources: l-arginine, aspartate, l-cysteine, l-methionine, phenylalanine and valine.
Resistant to cephalothin (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), neomycin (10 μg), rifampicin (30 μg) and bacitracin (10 units).
Sensitive to sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim (23.75/1.25 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg) and novobiocin (30 μg).
The polar lipids comprise phospholipids, aminolipids and phosphoglycolipids.
The type strain is SMB35T (=DSM 19940T =VKM B-2397T).
